main event: On March 25, 1952, a white glowing object was observed descending and continuing on its course at an altitude of about 10,000 feet.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 20-25 feet in diameter and moving at a speed of about 150 mph., The observation lasted for about 15 minutes before the object disappeared from sight., The conclusions of the sighting were varied, suggesting it could be a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon., The report indicates the object moved from the west., The witness reliability was assessed as appearing good according to the analysis.
